I don't view America's primary economic problem as anything but political corruption. Our available and future resources are being directed in an irresponsible manner while our politicians use public funds buying votes to perpetuate their policies. When a standard of living is maintained through debt, public and personal, the only issue determining a nation's direction is concentration on servicing that debt.
 
 Until our internal transaction oriented economy has a big hiccup that lowers our standard of living to a level excluding all but normal, repayable debt including a balanced budget with a defensive military, we'll continue to hope that China, India and others need our markets and debt to fuel their industrialization. With their potential internal markets, that time frame will be determined by how rapidly they raise their per-capita income to a level that consumes primary internal production with exports positioned for providing new wealth to offset inflation and replenish capital investment. 
 
 In the meantime, US infrastructure will continue deterioration, capital will continue to flee, our government will continue concentration on military power, wealth will continue shifting to the upper 20%, employment will continue adjusting to global wage standards or be lost and our internal social problems will continue rapid expansion as resources are directed at the military and debt service.
